capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed a male character in the Harry Potter series. I've always found him to be quite an intriguing figure, with his complex and often dark personality. His strict demeanor and sharp tongue can be quite intimidating, but at the same time, he has a certain depth to him that makes him more than just a one-dimensional villain.

Snape, the way he's always dressed in black is so intimidating. I mean, it's like he's trying to convey this sense of power and authority, but at the same time, it's just really sad that someone as talented as him has to hide behind that facade. He's a complex character, you know?
capsules_submitted.reply: i am curious. what institution is professor snape affiliated with?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a well-documented fact. He was indeed the Potions master at the school for many years, and his complex character added depth to the series. I've always found it interesting how he walked this fine line between being a strict teacher and having a certain... let's say, fondness for certain students.

Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was the Potions master for many years and had a certain... influence on the students, but at the same time, his behavior was often quite erratic and intimidating. He seemed to have a personal vendetta against Harry Potter, which made things very difficult for him as a teacher.
